name: Desktop Organizer
description: Automatically organizes desktop files into categorized folders (Images, Docs, Code, etc.)
author: Debosmita Majumdar

tasks.name: Organize Desktop
tasks.description: Organizes all files on desktop into categorized subfolders

tasks.name: Organize Custom Folder
tasks.description: Organizes files in a custom folder path

tasks.name: Dry Run (Simulation)
tasks.description: Shows what would be organized without making changes
tasks.script: import os, sys; sys.path.insert(0, '.'); from organizer import organize_folder; print('[DRY RUN] Would organize files')

documentation.setup:
1. Install Python 3.7+
2. Run 'python organizer.py'
3. Follow prompts
documentation.usage: Run the script and confirm when prompted. Files will be moved to categorized folders.
documentation.notes: Always backup important files before running. Use dry-run first if unsure.
documentation.troubleshooting: If files don't move, check permissions. On macOS/Linux, you may need 'chmod +x organizer.py'
